author: bridge-bot
content:
<gr3999> since there is no separate proposer vote because of OTS limitation and will be embedded in block body directly, there is no corresponding vote signature but signature over the entire block.

so if that vote needs to be repacked by some other block/aggregator, one will need to use the block aggregated signature proof as the input to the aggregated VM

so the signature VM needs to handle such proving from day 1 (devnet2, in devnet1 we can just do vote signature by the proposer instead of full block signature so that dependency on this part being ready is reduced)

author: bridge-bot
content:
<tcoratger> I would say that for the moment we don't have to worry more than that as we won't have an aggregation in devnet1.

Then we can bring this back to the table but I think that we will need some doc to clarify exactly what are the different scenarios we envision, in order to reach a global agreement between everyone on exactly what we will need to support or not support.

To give you more context, in the next few weeks the focus for us will be 100% on achieving the required performances for the Aggregate/Merge program. This is already a very very challenging cryptographic challenge. For now, we need a 6x performance improvement only for the simple Aggregate program to reach the 1000 signatures aggregated per second and we have not started to take care of the full Merge program. Then as the VM is designed to be modular, we can add new programs in there, but we will need to reach agreement on the exact needs that we have.
